page.title: 07Religion In Mayfield.
page.content: Mayfield has 4 churches.The 15th century Anglican Parish Church,St. Dunstan's has a congregation of about 200.Holy Communion is celebrated on Sunday mornings at 10.45 & is said each weekday morning.Evensong is said each evening & sung one Sunday evening each month.About 10 children belong to the Sunday School.The 20th century R.C.Church,St.Thomas of Canterbury,has 4 masses each weekend,one on Saturday & three on Sunday.Each weekend 160_170 people attend.The 19th century Strict Baptist Chapel has two services each Sunday,but has a small congregation. The Free Church has about 40 in the congregation each Sunday.Two services are held each Sunday.20 children attend the Sunday School.Outside the Free Church stands a memorial to the Mayfield Martyrs,burnt for their Protestant principles in 1556 & 1557.
